intro: Xanthophyllum citrifolium, commonly known as the lemon-leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and oval-shaped leaves that resemble citrus leaves. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae and is known for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Xanthophyllum citrifolium is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
